intro: Fuirena umbellata var. typica, commonly known as the typical umbellate fuirena, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound umbels of small white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often found in open woodlands and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
